hedline.hl1: To Rid Our Roads of Sport Utilities

abstract.p: Letter from Terry Hernon MacDonald, prompted by Ford Motor Co's admission that its sport utility vehicles endanger environment and other motorists, says only solution is for consumers to stop buying these too-large cars

block.p: Re ''Ford Is Conceding S.U.V. Drawbacks'' (front page, May 12): Any thinking person knows that sport utility vehicles endanger the environment and other motorists, but we can hardly blame the Ford Motor Company for continuing to make them when they are so profitable.
The alternative is for Ford to build smaller, more fuel-efficient cars, which the average American apparently does not want and will probably not buy.

Re ''Ford Is Conceding S.U.V. Drawbacks'' (front page, May 12): Any thinking person knows that sport utility vehicles endanger the environment and other motorists, but we can hardly blame the Ford Motor Company for continuing to make them when they are so profitable.
The alternative is for Ford to build smaller, more fuel-efficient cars, which the average American apparently does not want and will probably not buy.
The only solution to getting dangerous sport utility vehicles off the road is for consumers to ask themselves, Do I really need a vehicle that is capable of transporting circus animals?
Just because everybody else is driving one doesn't make it right.
TERRY HERNON MAC DONALD Seaford, N.Y., May 12, 2000
